# ngx-tailwindcss - Complete Documentation for AI/LLM

> A comprehensive, highly customizable Angular component library designed for Tailwind CSS 4+

## Table of Contents

1. [Overview](#overview)
2. [Installation](#installation)
3. [Configuration](#configuration)
4. [Components Reference](#components-reference)
5. [Directives Reference](#directives-reference)
6. [Customization Guide](#customization-guide)
7. [Best Practices](#best-practices)
8. [Common Patterns](#common-patterns)
9. [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)

---

## Overview

ngx-tailwindcss is an open-source Angular UI component library that provides 30+ production-ready components styled with Tailwind CSS 4+. It's designed for modern Angular applications (v19, v20, v21) using standalone components.

### Key Differentiators

1. **No Bundled CSS**: Unlike other UI libraries, ngx-tailwindcss doesn't bundle its own CSS. Components use Tailwind CSS classes that are processed by your app's Tailwind setup.

2. **Full Customization**: Every component supports `classOverride` (merge classes) and `classReplace` (replace classes) props.

3. **Modern Angular**: Uses signals, computed properties, and effects throughout. Compatible with zoneless change detection.

4. **Intelligent Class Merging**: Built-in `TwClassService` handles Tailwind class conflicts intelligently.

---

## Installation

### Step 1: Install the package

```bash
# Using pnpm (recommended)
pnpm add @pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss

# Using npm
npm install @pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss

# Using yarn
yarn add @pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss
```

### Step 2: Configure Tailwind CSS

In your `styles.css` or `styles.scss`:

```css
@import "tailwindcss";

/* IMPORTANT: Add this line to scan the library for Tailwind classes */
@source "../node_modules/@pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss/**/*.mjs";
```

### Step 3: Import Components

```typescript
import { TwButtonComponent, TwCardComponent } from '@pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss';

@Component({
  standalone: true,
  imports: [TwButtonComponent, TwCardComponent],
  // ...
})
export class MyComponent {}
```

---

## Configuration

### Global Configuration with provideTwConfig

```typescript
import { ApplicationConfig } from '@angular/core';
import { provideTwConfig } from '@pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss';

export const appConfig: ApplicationConfig = {
  providers: [
    provideTwConfig({
      // Animation duration in milliseconds
      animationDuration: 200,

      // Custom theme variants
      theme: {
        primary: 'bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700 text-white focus-visible:ring-blue-500',
        secondary: 'bg-slate-600 hover:bg-slate-700 text-white focus-visible:ring-slate-500',
        success: 'bg-emerald-600 hover:bg-emerald-700 text-white focus-visible:ring-emerald-500',
        warning: 'bg-amber-500 hover:bg-amber-600 text-white focus-visible:ring-amber-500',
        danger: 'bg-rose-600 hover:bg-rose-700 text-white focus-visible:ring-rose-500',
        info: 'bg-cyan-600 hover:bg-cyan-700 text-white focus-visible:ring-cyan-500',
      },
    }),
  ]
};
```

---

## Components Reference

### Button Component (tw-button)

The most commonly used component. Supports multiple variants, sizes, and states.

```html
<!-- Basic usage -->
<tw-button>Click me</tw-button>

<!-- With variant -->
<tw-button variant="primary">Primary</tw-button>
<tw-button variant="secondary">Secondary</tw-button>
<tw-button variant="success">Success</tw-button>
<tw-button variant="warning">Warning</tw-button>
<tw-button variant="danger">Danger</tw-button>
<tw-button variant="ghost">Ghost</tw-button>
<tw-button variant="outline">Outline</tw-button>
<tw-button variant="link">Link</tw-button>

<!-- Sizes -->
<tw-button size="xs">Extra Small</tw-button>
<tw-button size="sm">Small</tw-button>
<tw-button size="md">Medium (default)</tw-button>
<tw-button size="lg">Large</tw-button>
<tw-button size="xl">Extra Large</tw-button>

<!-- States -->
<tw-button [disabled]="true">Disabled</tw-button>
<tw-button [loading]="true">Loading</tw-button>

<!-- With icon -->
<tw-button>
  <fa-icon [icon]="faCheck" class="mr-2"></fa-icon>
  Save
</tw-button>

<!-- Icon only -->
<tw-button [iconOnly]="true" aria-label="Settings">
  <fa-icon [icon]="faCog"></fa-icon>
</tw-button>

<!-- With ripple effect (enabled by default) -->
<tw-button [ripple]="true">With Ripple</tw-button>
<tw-button [ripple]="false">Without Ripple</tw-button>

<!-- Custom classes -->
<tw-button classOverride="rounded-full shadow-lg">Rounded</tw-button>
```

**Inputs:**
- `variant`: 'primary' | 'secondary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'danger' | 'ghost' | 'outline' | 'link'
- `size`: 'xs' | 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' | 'xl'
- `disabled`: boolean
- `loading`: boolean
- `iconOnly`: boolean
- `ripple`: boolean (default: true)
- `rippleColor`: string (default: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.4)')
- `classOverride`: string (merge additional classes)
- `classReplace`: string (replace all classes)

**Outputs:**
- `onClick`: EventEmitter<MouseEvent>

---

### Card Component (tw-card)

Container component with optional header, body, and footer sections.

```html
<!-- Basic card -->
<tw-card>
  <p>Card content</p>
</tw-card>

<!-- With directives -->
<tw-card>
  <ng-container twCardHeader>
    <tw-card-title>Card Title</tw-card-title>
    <tw-card-subtitle>Subtitle</tw-card-subtitle>
  </ng-container>

  <ng-container twCardBody>
    <p>Card body content goes here.</p>
  </ng-container>

  <ng-container twCardFooter>
    <tw-button variant="primary">Action</tw-button>
  </ng-container>
</tw-card>

<!-- Variants -->
<tw-card variant="elevated">Elevated card with shadow</tw-card>
<tw-card variant="outlined">Outlined card with border</tw-card>
<tw-card variant="filled">Filled card with background</tw-card>

<!-- Hoverable -->
<tw-card [hover]="true">Hover effect on mouse over</tw-card>

<!-- Clickable -->
<tw-card [clickable]="true" (cardClick)="onCardClick()">
  Clickable card
</tw-card>
```

---

### Input Component (tw-input)

Form input with label, helper text, and validation states.

```html
<!-- Basic input -->
<tw-input label="Email" placeholder="Enter your email"></tw-input>

<!-- With ngModel -->
<tw-input
  label="Username"
  [(ngModel)]="username"
  [required]="true">
</tw-input>

<!-- Variants -->
<tw-input variant="default" label="Default"></tw-input>
<tw-input variant="filled" label="Filled"></tw-input>
<tw-input variant="outlined" label="Outlined"></tw-input>

<!-- Sizes -->
<tw-input size="sm" label="Small"></tw-input>
<tw-input size="md" label="Medium"></tw-input>
<tw-input size="lg" label="Large"></tw-input>

<!-- States -->
<tw-input [disabled]="true" label="Disabled"></tw-input>
<tw-input [readonly]="true" label="Readonly" value="Read only value"></tw-input>
<tw-input [error]="true" errorMessage="This field is required" label="Error"></tw-input>

<!-- With helper text -->
<tw-input
  label="Password"
  type="password"
  helperText="Must be at least 8 characters">
</tw-input>

<!-- With prefix/suffix -->
<tw-input label="Price">
  <span prefix>$</span>
  <span suffix>.00</span>
</tw-input>
```

---

### Modal Component (tw-modal)

Dialog/modal component with focus trapping and keyboard support.

```html
<!-- Basic modal -->
<tw-button (click)="showModal = true">Open Modal</tw-button>

<tw-modal [(open)]="showModal" title="Modal Title">
  <p>Modal content goes here.</p>

  <tw-modal-footer>
    <tw-button variant="ghost" (click)="showModal = false">Cancel</tw-button>
    <tw-button variant="primary">Confirm</tw-button>
  </tw-modal-footer>
</tw-modal>

<!-- Sizes -->
<tw-modal size="sm">Small modal</tw-modal>
<tw-modal size="md">Medium modal (default)</tw-modal>
<tw-modal size="lg">Large modal</tw-modal>
<tw-modal size="xl">Extra large modal</tw-modal>
<tw-modal size="full">Full screen modal</tw-modal>

<!-- Prevent close on backdrop click -->
<tw-modal [closeOnBackdrop]="false">
  Can only be closed via close button or ESC key
</tw-modal>

<!-- Prevent close on ESC key -->
<tw-modal [closeOnEscape]="false">
  ESC key won't close this modal
</tw-modal>
```

---

### Table Component (tw-table)

Data table with sorting, selection, and styling options.

```html
<tw-table
  [data]="users"
  [columns]="columns"
  [selectable]="true"
  [(selection)]="selectedUsers"
  [sortable]="true"
  (sort)="onSort($event)">
</tw-table>
```

```typescript
columns = [
  { field: 'name', header: 'Name', sortable: true },
  { field: 'email', header: 'Email', sortable: true },
  { field: 'role', header: 'Role' },
];

users = [
  { name: 'John Doe', email: 'john@example.com', role: 'Admin' },
  { name: 'Jane Smith', email: 'jane@example.com', role: 'User' },
];
```

---

### Tabs Component (tw-tabs)

Tabbed navigation with multiple style variants.

```html
<tw-tabs [(activeTab)]="activeTab">
  <tw-tab-panel label="Tab 1" value="tab1">
    Content for tab 1
  </tw-tab-panel>
  <tw-tab-panel label="Tab 2" value="tab2">
    Content for tab 2
  </tw-tab-panel>
  <tw-tab-panel label="Tab 3" value="tab3" [disabled]="true">
    Disabled tab
  </tw-tab-panel>
</tw-tabs>

<!-- Variants -->
<tw-tabs variant="default">Default tabs</tw-tabs>
<tw-tabs variant="pills">Pill-style tabs</tw-tabs>
<tw-tabs variant="soft-rounded">Soft rounded tabs</tw-tabs>
<tw-tabs variant="bordered">Bordered tabs</tw-tabs>
```

---

### Toast Service

Programmatic toast notifications.

```typescript
import { TwToastService } from '@pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss';

@Component({...})
export class MyComponent {
  private toast = inject(TwToastService);

  showSuccess() {
    this.toast.success('Operation completed successfully!');
  }

  showError() {
    this.toast.error('An error occurred', { duration: 5000 });
  }

  showWarning() {
    this.toast.warning('Please review your input');
  }

  showInfo() {
    this.toast.info('New update available');
  }

  showCustom() {
    this.toast.show({
      message: 'Custom toast',
      variant: 'info',
      position: 'top-right',
      duration: 3000,
      dismissible: true,
    });
  }
}
```

---

## Directives Reference

### Core Directives

#### Ripple Directive (twRipple)

Adds Material-style ripple effect to any element.

```html
<button twRipple>Click for ripple</button>
<div twRipple rippleColor="rgba(0,0,255,0.3)">Blue ripple</div>
<button twRipple [rippleDisabled]="true">No ripple</button>
```

#### Tooltip Directive (twTooltip)

Adds tooltips to elements.

```html
<button twTooltip="This is a tooltip">Hover me</button>
<button twTooltip="Top tooltip" tooltipPosition="top">Top</button>
<button twTooltip="Bottom tooltip" tooltipPosition="bottom">Bottom</button>
<button twTooltip="Left tooltip" tooltipPosition="left">Left</button>
<button twTooltip="Right tooltip" tooltipPosition="right">Right</button>
```

#### Click Outside Directive (twClickOutside)

Detects clicks outside an element.

```html
<div twClickOutside (twClickOutside)="closeDropdown()">
  Dropdown content
</div>
```

#### Focus Trap Directive (twFocusTrap)

Traps focus within an element (useful for modals).

```html
<div twFocusTrap [twFocusTrapEnabled]="isOpen">
  <input placeholder="First focusable" />
  <button>Second focusable</button>
  <button>Last focusable (focus wraps to first)</button>
</div>
```

#### Class Merge Directive (twClass)

Intelligently merges Tailwind classes.

```html
<div twClass="p-4 bg-blue-500" [twClass]="dynamicClasses">
  Classes are merged intelligently
</div>
```

---

### DX Enhancement Directives

#### Auto Focus Directive (twAutoFocus)

Automatically focus an element when it's rendered.

```html
<input twAutoFocus />
<input twAutoFocus [autoFocusDelay]="100" />
<input [twAutoFocus]="shouldFocus" [autoFocusSelect]="true" />
```

**Inputs:**
- `twAutoFocus`: boolean - Enable/disable auto-focus
- `autoFocusDelay`: number - Delay in ms before focusing
- `autoFocusSelect`: boolean - Select text content (for inputs)
- `autoFocusScroll`: boolean - Scroll element into view

#### In View Directive (twInView)

Detect when an element enters or leaves the viewport using IntersectionObserver.

```html
<div twInView (inView)="onVisible($event)">Lazy content</div>
<div twInView [inViewThreshold]="0.5" (enterView)="onEnter()">50% visible trigger</div>
<div twInView [inViewOnce]="true" (enterView)="loadOnce()">Load once</div>
```

**Inputs:**
- `inViewRootMargin`: string - Root margin (CSS margin syntax)
- `inViewThreshold`: number | number[] - Visibility threshold (0-1)
- `inViewOnce`: boolean - Only trigger once
- `inViewDisabled`: boolean - Disable observer

**Outputs:**
- `inView`: InViewEvent - Emits on any intersection change
- `enterView`: InViewEvent - Emits when entering viewport
- `leaveView`: InViewEvent - Emits when leaving viewport

#### Long Press Directive (twLongPress)

Detect long press/touch events.

```html
<button twLongPress (longPress)="onLongPress($event)">Hold me</button>
<button twLongPress [longPressDuration]="1000" (longPress)="onLongPress($event)">Hold 1 second</button>
```

**Inputs:**
- `longPressDuration`: number - Duration in ms to trigger (default: 500)
- `longPressMoveTolerance`: number - Max movement allowed (default: 10px)
- `longPressPreventDefault`: boolean - Prevent context menu

**Outputs:**
- `longPress`: LongPressEvent - Emits when long press detected
- `pressStart`: void - Emits when press starts
- `pressEnd`: void - Emits when press ends

#### Debounce Click Directive (twDebounceClick)

Debounce click events to prevent accidental double-clicks.

```html
<button twDebounceClick (debounceClick)="onSave()">Save</button>
<button twDebounceClick [debounceTime]="500" (debounceClick)="onSubmit()">Submit</button>
```

**Inputs:**
- `debounceTime`: number - Debounce time in ms (default: 300)
- `debounceDisabled`: boolean - Disable debouncing

**Outputs:**
- `debounceClick`: MouseEvent - Emits debounced click

#### Copy Clipboard Directive (twCopyClipboard)

Copy text to clipboard on click.

```html
<button twCopyClipboard="Text to copy" (copied)="onCopied($event)">Copy</button>
<button [twCopyClipboard]="dynamicText" (copied)="showToast($event.success ? 'Copied!' : 'Failed')">Copy</button>
```

**Inputs:**
- `twCopyClipboard`: string - Text to copy
- `copyDisabled`: boolean - Disable copying

**Outputs:**
- `copied`: CopyClipboardEvent - Emits with success/error status

#### Keyboard Shortcut Directive (twKeyboardShortcut)

Handle keyboard shortcuts.

```html
<div twKeyboardShortcut="ctrl+s" (shortcutPressed)="onSave($event)">Press Ctrl+S</div>
<div twKeyboardShortcut="ctrl+shift+p" (shortcutPressed)="openPalette()">Command Palette</div>
<div twKeyboardShortcut="escape" (shortcutPressed)="onEscape()">Press ESC</div>
```

**Supported modifiers:** ctrl, alt, shift, meta (cmd on Mac)
**Key names:** Any KeyboardEvent.key value (a-z, 0-9, enter, escape, space, etc.)

**Inputs:**
- `twKeyboardShortcut`: string - Shortcut string (e.g., "ctrl+s")
- `shortcutGlobal`: boolean - Listen globally (default: true)
- `shortcutPreventDefault`: boolean - Prevent default browser behavior
- `shortcutStopPropagation`: boolean - Stop event propagation

**Outputs:**
- `shortcutPressed`: KeyboardShortcutEvent - Emits when shortcut pressed

#### Swipe Directive (twSwipe)

Detect swipe gestures.

```html
<div twSwipe (swipe)="onSwipe($event)">Swipe me</div>
<div twSwipe (swipeLeft)="goNext()" (swipeRight)="goPrev()">Carousel</div>
<div twSwipe [swipeThreshold]="100" (swipeUp)="refresh()">Pull to refresh</div>
```

**Inputs:**
- `swipeThreshold`: number - Min distance to trigger (default: 50px)
- `swipeTimeout`: number - Max time for swipe (default: 300ms)
- `swipeVelocity`: number - Min velocity (default: 0.3)

**Outputs:**
- `swipe`: SwipeEvent - Emits on any swipe
- `swipeLeft`: SwipeEvent - Emits on swipe left
- `swipeRight`: SwipeEvent - Emits on swipe right
- `swipeUp`: SwipeEvent - Emits on swipe up
- `swipeDown`: SwipeEvent - Emits on swipe down

#### Resize Observer Directive (twResizeObserver)

Observe element size changes.

```html
<div twResizeObserver (resize)="onResize($event)">Resizable content</div>
<div twResizeObserver [resizeDebounce]="100" (resize)="onResize($event)">Debounced</div>
```

**Inputs:**
- `resizeDebounce`: number - Debounce time in ms (default: 0)
- `resizeDisabled`: boolean - Disable observer

**Outputs:**
- `resize`: ResizeEvent - Emits with width, height, entry

#### Lazy Image Directive (twLazyImage)

Lazy load images when they enter the viewport.

```html
<img twLazyImage="/image.jpg" [lazyPlaceholder]="'/placeholder.jpg'" (lazyLoaded)="onLoaded($event)" />
<img twLazyImage="/large.jpg" lazyLoadingClass="opacity-0" lazyLoadedClass="opacity-100 transition-opacity" />
```

**Inputs:**
- `twLazyImage`: string - Image source to lazy load
- `lazyPlaceholder`: string - Placeholder image
- `lazyLoadingClass`: string - CSS class while loading
- `lazyLoadedClass`: string - CSS class after loaded
- `lazyRootMargin`: string - Intersection observer root margin
- `lazyNative`: boolean - Use native loading="lazy"

**Outputs:**
- `lazyLoaded`: LazyImageEvent - Emits when image loads or errors

#### Scroll To Directive (twScrollTo)

Smooth scroll to a target element.

```html
<a twScrollTo="#section1">Go to Section 1</a>
<a twScrollTo="#top" [scrollOffset]="80">Back to Top</a>
<button twScrollTo=".my-element" scrollBehavior="auto">Jump</button>
```

**Inputs:**
- `twScrollTo`: string - Target selector or element ID
- `scrollOffset`: number - Offset from top (for fixed headers)
- `scrollBehavior`: 'smooth' | 'auto' - Scroll behavior
- `scrollBlock`: ScrollLogicalPosition - Block position

#### Hover Class Directive (twHoverClass)

Dynamically add/remove classes on hover.

```html
<div twHoverClass="scale-105 shadow-lg">Hover me</div>
<div twHoverClass="bg-blue-500 text-white" [hoverClassBase]="'bg-white text-black'">Toggle colors</div>
<div twHoverClass="ring-2 ring-blue-500" [hoverDelay]="200">Delayed effect</div>
```

**Inputs:**
- `twHoverClass`: string - Classes to add on hover
- `hoverClassBase`: string - Classes to remove on hover (restore on leave)
- `hoverDelay`: number - Delay before applying (ms)
- `hoverLeaveDelay`: number - Delay before removing (ms)

#### Trap Scroll Directive (twTrapScroll)

Trap scroll within an element, preventing scroll propagation to parent.

```html
<div twTrapScroll class="h-64 overflow-auto">
  <div class="h-[1000px]">Long content - scrolling won't affect parent</div>
</div>
```

**Inputs:**
- `trapScrollDisabled`: boolean - Disable scroll trapping
- `trapScrollAllowHorizontal`: boolean - Allow horizontal scroll to propagate

---

## Customization Guide

### Method 1: classOverride (Merge)

Add additional classes that merge with defaults:

```html
<tw-button
  variant="primary"
  classOverride="rounded-full shadow-xl hover:shadow-2xl">
  Fancy Button
</tw-button>
```

### Method 2: classReplace (Replace)

Completely replace all classes:

```html
<tw-button
  classReplace="bg-gradient-to-r from-purple-500 to-pink-500 text-white px-6 py-3 rounded-lg">
  Gradient Button
</tw-button>
```

### Method 3: Global Configuration

Set defaults for all components:

```typescript
provideTwConfig({
  theme: {
    primary: 'bg-indigo-600 hover:bg-indigo-700 text-white',
  },
})
```

### Method 4: CSS Variables

Override using CSS custom properties in your styles:

```css
:root {
  --tw-primary-bg: theme('colors.indigo.600');
  --tw-primary-hover: theme('colors.indigo.700');
}
```

---

## Best Practices

### 1. Import Only What You Need

```typescript
// Good - tree-shakeable
import { TwButtonComponent, TwCardComponent } from '@pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss';

// Avoid - imports everything
import * as Tw from '@pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss';
```

### 2. Use Semantic Variants

```html
<!-- Good - semantic meaning -->
<tw-button variant="success">Save</tw-button>
<tw-button variant="danger">Delete</tw-button>

<!-- Avoid - hard to maintain -->
<tw-button classReplace="bg-green-500 text-white">Save</tw-button>
```

### 3. Prefer classOverride Over classReplace

```html
<!-- Good - maintains base styles -->
<tw-button classOverride="rounded-full">Rounded</tw-button>

<!-- Use classReplace only when you need complete control -->
<tw-button classReplace="custom-btn-class">Custom</tw-button>
```

### 4. Accessibility

All components include proper ARIA attributes, but always add context:

```html
<tw-button [iconOnly]="true" aria-label="Delete item">
  <fa-icon [icon]="faTrash"></fa-icon>
</tw-button>
```

---

## Common Patterns

### Form with Validation

```html
<form [formGroup]="form" (ngSubmit)="onSubmit()">
  <tw-input
    formControlName="email"
    label="Email"
    [error]="form.get('email')?.invalid && form.get('email')?.touched"
    errorMessage="Valid email required">
  </tw-input>

  <tw-input
    formControlName="password"
    type="password"
    label="Password"
    [error]="form.get('password')?.invalid && form.get('password')?.touched"
    errorMessage="Password must be 8+ characters">
  </tw-input>

  <tw-button type="submit" variant="primary" [disabled]="form.invalid">
    Submit
  </tw-button>
</form>
```

### Confirmation Modal

```html
<tw-modal [(open)]="showConfirm" title="Confirm Delete">
  <p>Are you sure you want to delete this item? This action cannot be undone.</p>

  <tw-modal-footer>
    <tw-button variant="ghost" (click)="showConfirm = false">Cancel</tw-button>
    <tw-button variant="danger" (click)="confirmDelete()">Delete</tw-button>
  </tw-modal-footer>
</tw-modal>
```

### Data Table with Actions

```html
<tw-table [data]="items" [columns]="columns">
  <ng-template #actions let-row>
    <tw-button size="sm" variant="ghost" (click)="edit(row)">
      <fa-icon [icon]="faEdit"></fa-icon>
    </tw-button>
    <tw-button size="sm" variant="ghost" (click)="delete(row)">
      <fa-icon [icon]="faTrash"></fa-icon>
    </tw-button>
  </ng-template>
</tw-table>
```

---

## Troubleshooting

### Styles Not Applied

**Problem:** Components render but without Tailwind styles.

**Solution:** Ensure you've added the @source directive in your CSS:

```css
@source "../node_modules/@pegasus-heavy/ngx-tailwindcss/**/*.mjs";
```

### Class Conflicts

**Problem:** Custom classes not overriding default styles.

**Solution:** Use `classOverride` for merging or `classReplace` for complete override. The `TwClassService` handles most conflicts automatically, but you may need to use `!important` utilities like `!bg-red-500` for edge cases.

### Injection Errors

**Problem:** `NG0203: inject() must be called from an injection context`

**Solution:** Ensure you're using Angular 19+ and have configured the library correctly. The library uses field initializers for dependency injection, which requires proper Angular compilation.

---

## Version Compatibility

| ngx-tailwindcss | Angular | Tailwind CSS |
|-----------------|---------|--------------|
| 0.1.x           | 19, 20, 21 | 4.x |
